verses.verse: When <S%H3588><s%> thou sittest <S%H3427><s%> to eat <S%H3898><s%> with <S%H854><s%> a ruler, <S%H4910><s%> consider diligently <S%H995><s%> <S%H995><s%> <S%H853><s%> what <S%H834><s%> is before <S%H6440><s%> thee:
And put <S%H7760><s%> a knife <S%H7915><s%> to thy throat, <S%H3930><s%> if <S%H518><s%> thou <S%H859><s%> be a man <S%H1167><s%> given to appetite. <S%H5315><s%>
Be not <S%H408><s%> desirous <S%H183><s%> of his dainties: <S%H4303><s%> for they <S%H1931><s%> are deceitful <S%H3577><s%> meat. <S%H3899><s%>
Labor <S%H3021><s%> not <S%H408><s%> to be rich: <S%H6238><s%> cease <S%H2308><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> thine own wisdom. <S%H998><s%>

Wilt thou set <S%H5774><s%> thine eyes <S%H5869><s%> upon that which is not? <S%H369><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> riches certainly make <S%H6213><s%> <S%H6213><s%> themselves wings; <S%H3671><s%> they fly away <S%H5774><s%> as an eagle <S%H5404><s%> toward heaven. <S%H8064><s%>

Eat <S%H3898><s%> thou not <S%H408><s%> <S%H853><s%> the bread <S%H3899><s%> of him that hath an evil <S%H7451><s%> eye, <S%H5869><s%> neither <S%H408><s%> desire <S%H183><s%> thou his dainty meats: <S%H4303><s%>

For <S%H3588><s%> as <S%H3644><s%> he thinketh <S%H8176><s%> in his heart, <S%H5315><s%> so <S%H3651><s%> is he: <S%H1931><s%> Eat <S%H398><s%> and drink, <S%H8354><s%> saith <S%H559><s%> he to thee; but his heart <S%H3820><s%> is not <S%H1077><s%> with thee. <S%H5973><s%>
The morsel <S%H6595><s%> which thou hast eaten <S%H398><s%> shalt thou vomit up, <S%H6958><s%> and lose <S%H7843><s%> thy sweet <S%H5273><s%> words. <S%H1697><s%>
Speak <S%H1696><s%> not <S%H408><s%> in the ears <S%H241><s%> of a fool: <S%H3684><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> he will despise <S%H936><s%> the wisdom <S%H7922><s%> of thy words. <S%H4405><s%>
Remove <S%H5253><s%> not <S%H408><s%> the old <S%H5769><s%> landmark; <S%H1366><s%> and enter <S%H935><s%> not <S%H408><s%> into the fields <S%H7704><s%> of the fatherless: <S%H3490><s%>
For <S%H3588><s%> their redeemer <S%H1350><s%> is mighty; <S%H2389><s%> he <S%H1931><s%> shall plead <S%H7378><s%> <S%H853><s%> their cause <S%H7379><s%> with <S%H854><s%> thee.
Apply <S%H935><s%> thine heart <S%H3820><s%> unto instruction, <S%H4148><s%> and thine ears <S%H241><s%> to the words <S%H561><s%> of knowledge. <S%H1847><s%>

Withhold <S%H4513><s%> not <S%H408><s%> correction <S%H4148><s%> from the child: <S%H4480><s%> <S%H5288><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> if thou beatest <S%H5221><s%> him with the rod, <S%H7626><s%> he shall not <S%H3808><s%> die. <S%H4191><s%>
Thou <S%H859><s%> shalt beat <S%H5221><s%> him with the rod, <S%H7626><s%> and shalt deliver <S%H5337><s%> his soul <S%H5315><s%> from hell. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H7585><s%>
My son, <S%H1121><s%> if <S%H518><s%> thine heart <S%H3820><s%> be wise, <S%H2449><s%> my heart <S%H3820><s%> shall rejoice, <S%H8055><s%> even <S%H1571><s%> mine. <S%H589><s%>
Yea, my reins <S%H3629><s%> shall rejoice, <S%H5937><s%> when thy lips <S%H8193><s%> speak <S%H1696><s%> right things. <S%H4339><s%>

Let not <S%H408><s%> thine heart <S%H3820><s%> envy <S%H7065><s%> sinners: <S%H2400><s%> but <S%H3588><s%> be thou in the fear <S%H3374><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the day <S%H3117><s%> long.
For <S%H3588><s%> surely <S%H518><s%> there is <S%H3426><s%> an end; <S%H319><s%> and thine expectation <S%H8615><s%> shall not <S%H3808><s%> be cut off. <S%H3772><s%>
Hear <S%H8085><s%> thou, <S%H859><s%> my son, <S%H1121><s%> and be wise, <S%H2449><s%> and guide <S%H833><s%> thine heart <S%H3820><s%> in the way. <S%H1870><s%>
Be <S%H1961><s%> not <S%H408><s%> among winebibbers; <S%H5433><s%> <S%H3196><s%> among riotous eaters <S%H2151><s%> of flesh: <S%H1320><s%>
For <S%H3588><s%> the drunkard <S%H5433><s%> and the glutton <S%H2151><s%> shall come to poverty: <S%H3423><s%> and drowsiness <S%H5124><s%> shall clothe <S%H3847><s%> a man with rags. <S%H7168><s%>

Hearken <S%H8085><s%> unto thy father <S%H1><s%> that <S%H2088><s%> begot <S%H3205><s%> thee, and despise <S%H936><s%> not <S%H408><s%> thy mother <S%H517><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> she is old. <S%H2204><s%>
Buy <S%H7069><s%> the truth, <S%H571><s%> and sell <S%H4376><s%> it not; <S%H408><s%> also wisdom, <S%H2451><s%> and instruction, <S%H4148><s%> and understanding. <S%H998><s%>

The father <S%H1><s%> of the righteous <S%H6662><s%> shall greatly rejoice: <S%H1523><s%> <S%H1523><s%> and he that begetteth <S%H3205><s%> a wise <S%H2450><s%> child shall have joy <S%H8055><s%> of him.
Thy father <S%H1><s%> and thy mother <S%H517><s%> shall be glad, <S%H8055><s%> and she that bore <S%H3205><s%> thee shall rejoice. <S%H1523><s%>
My son, <S%H1121><s%> give <S%H5414><s%> me thine heart, <S%H3820><s%> and let thine eyes <S%H5869><s%> observe <S%H5341><s%> my ways. <S%H1870><s%>
For <S%H3588><s%> a whore <S%H2181><s%> is a deep <S%H6013><s%> ditch; <S%H7745><s%> and a strange <S%H5237><s%> woman is a narrow <S%H6862><s%> pit. <S%H875><s%>
She <S%H1931><s%> also <S%H637><s%> lieth in wait <S%H693><s%> as for a prey, <S%H2863><s%> and increaseth <S%H3254><s%> the transgressors <S%H898><s%> among men. <S%H120><s%>

Who <S%H4310><s%> hath woe? <S%H188><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> hath sorrow? <S%H17><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> hath contentions? <S%H4079><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> hath babbling? <S%H7879><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> hath wounds <S%H6482><s%> without cause? <S%H2600><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> hath redness <S%H2448><s%> of eyes? <S%H5869><s%>
They that tarry long <S%H309><s%> at <S%H5921><s%> the wine; <S%H3196><s%> they that go <S%H935><s%> to seek <S%H2713><s%> mixed wine. <S%H4469><s%>

Look <S%H7200><s%> not <S%H408><s%> thou upon the wine <S%H3196><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> it is red, <S%H119><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> it giveth <S%H5414><s%> his color <S%H5869><s%> in the cup, <S%H3563><s%> when it moveth itself <S%H1980><s%> aright. <S%H4339><s%>
At the last <S%H319><s%> it biteth <S%H5391><s%> like a serpent, <S%H5175><s%> and stingeth <S%H6567><s%> like an adder. <S%H6848><s%>
Thine eyes <S%H5869><s%> shall behold <S%H7200><s%> strange women, <S%H2114><s%> and thine heart <S%H3820><s%> shall utter <S%H1696><s%> perverse things. <S%H8419><s%>

Yea, thou shalt be <S%H1961><s%> as he that lieth down <S%H7901><s%> in the midst <S%H3820><s%> of the sea, <S%H3220><s%> or as he that lieth <S%H7901><s%> upon the top <S%H7218><s%> of a mast. <S%H2260><s%>

They have stricken <S%H5221><s%> me, shalt thou say, and I was not <S%H1077><s%> sick; <S%H2470><s%> they have beaten <S%H1986><s%> me, and I felt <S%H3045><s%> it not: <S%H1077><s%> when <S%H4970><s%> shall I awake? <S%H6974><s%> I will seek <S%H1245><s%> it yet <S%H3254><s%> again. <S%H5750><s%>
